architecture.characters

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • architecture.characters.Combatant
        • architecture.characters.Monster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Skeleton

    public abstract class Monster
extends Combatant
    Represents monsters, Combatant enemies of the game. Specific traits of each monster (name, attribute distribution, etc.) are handled by children classes.

      • death

        public void death()
        Description copied from class: Combatant
        Method called when health of Combatant reaches zero. Death of monster removes it from the game and awards exp/items to player, while death of player ends the game.
        Overrides:
        death in class Combatant

      • updateAttributes

        public void updateAttributes()
        Description copied from class: Combatant
        Updates the attributes of the Combatant, which in turn updates the stats. Method is called whenever equipment or volatile effects change.
        Specified by:
        updateAttributes in class Combatant

      • updateStats

        protected void updateStats()
        Description copied from class: Combatant
        Updates the stats of the combatant based purely on attributes and volatile effects.
        Overrides:
        updateStats in class Combatant

      • sumOf

        protected static double sumOf(double[] array)

      • isMagicDamage

        public abstract boolean isMagicDamage()
        Used to denote magic or physical damage type monsters
        Returns:
        true if magical damage, false if physical damage

      • defenseFactor

        public abstract double defenseFactor()
        Used to store defensive capabilities of a Monster, relative to other classes of Monsters
        Returns:
        defenseFactor, used to calculate DEF based on level

      • attributeDistribution

        public abstract double[] attributeDistribution()
        Used to store the relative chances of an attribute being raised each level up. Actual probability is calculated by dividing each element in the array by the array's sum.
        Returns:
        relative probabilities of an attribute being raised for each level up

      • distributionRatios

        public double[] distributionRatios()
        Used to store the actual probabilities of each attribute being raised for each level up.
        Returns:
        probabilities of an attribute being raised for each level up

      • printDistributionRatios

        public void printDistributionRatios()
        For testing. Prints out the average increase in each stat per level.

      • type

        public abstract java.lang.String type()
        Used to store a String representation of the type of Monster.
        Returns:
        String of Monster type

      • intelligence

        public void intelligence()
        Movement AI. The Monster moves toward the player if the player has/had moved into a certain range.
